algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) on states represented by bitmasks
problem_summary_simple: Find minimum flips to make a binary matrix all zeros, flipping neighbors too.
problem_summary_technical: BFS on matrix states (bitmasks), where each state transition involves flipping a cell and its 4 neighbors.
key_insights: The small constraints (m, n <= 3) allow for exploring all possible states using bitmasks.
BFS guarantees finding the shortest path (minimum flips) from the initial state to the zero matrix state.
Flipping a cell twice is equivalent to not flipping it, simplifying the state transitions.
The problem can be modeled as finding the shortest path in a state graph where nodes are matrix configurations.
